description: Triangle of partial sums of column sequences of triangle A060086.
comments: In the language of the Shapiro et al. reference (given in A053121) such a lower triangular (ordinary) convolution array, considered as a matrix, belongs to the Riordan-group. The G.f. for the row polynomials p(n,x)= sum(a(n,m)*x^m,m=0..n) is (1/(1-x*z/((1-z^2)*(1-z))))/(1-z).Row sums give A052534. Column sequences (without leading zeros) give A000012 (powers of 1), A002620(n+1), A002624, A060099-A060101 for m=0..5.The bisections of the column sequences give triangles A060102 and A060556.Riordan array (1/(1-x), x/((1-x)*(1-x^2))). - _Paul Barry_, Mar 28 2011
formula: G.f. for column m >= 0: ((x/((1-x^2)*(1-x)))^m)/(1-x)= x^m/((1+x)^m*(1-x)^(2*m+1)).Number triangle T(n,k)=sum{i=0..floor(n/2), C(n-2*i,n-2*i-k)*C(k+i-1,i)}. - _Paul Barry_, Mar 28 2011
